newsitem.title: LEBANON: Kuwait firm wins $24 mln Beirut deal.
newsitem.headline: Kuwait firm wins $24 mln Beirut deal.

text.p: Lebanon's Investment Development Authority (LIDA) has awarded a Kuwaiti company a $24 million contract to build a 2,350-car underground parking lot at Beirut airport, the Lebanese Investment Development Authority (LIDA) said on Thursday.
The Abdel-Mohsen el-Khorafi company won the BOT (Build, Operate, Transfer) deal against competition from a Saudi-Lebanese company and a French-Lebanese company, a LIDA official told Reuters.
Construction will start this year and is scheduled to take two years. The Kuwaiti company will manage the parking lot for 15 years, the official said.
